results.title: Shop 16
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Shawn Reece and ACMI
results.brief_description: Shawn Reece had no confidence and stayed at home when he wasn’t at school. That is, until his friend convinced him to come along to Shop 16, a youth centre run by the Salvation Army in Reservoir.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Shawn Reece and ACMI

results.title: Just another bump in the road!!!
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Michelle Carlin and ACMI
results.brief_description: Michelle Carlin loved her job caring for disabled people. It has encouraged her to take a positive outlook on life no matter how much things go wrong and in turn this has helped her through some very tough times.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Michelle Carlin and ACMI

results.title: Bringing me home
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Karen Greer and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Mitchell River is the largest unregulated river in Victoria. To Karen Greer, it is her home and ever since childhood, she has navigated the waters and continues tracing the river upstream.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Karen Greer and ACMI
results.description: The Mitchell River is the largest unregulated river in Victoria. To Karen Greer, it is her home and ever since childhood, she has navigated the waters and continues tracing the river upstream.

results.title: You really had to be there!
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Dean Turner and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dean Turner cherishes the Punk Rock nights at the Arthouse in North Melbourne, where you could drink, hang out and have your five minutes of fame. Poverty is their way of life, but music uplifts them.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Dean Turner and ACMI

results.title: Raptor
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Cynthia Potter and ACMI
results.brief_description: Cynthia Potter tells of her life in one of Melbourne’s Housing Commission flats and her beloved son Elvis. Energetic, with a passion for insects, Elvis makes the most of life, while Potter does the best she can with what she’s got.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Cynthia Potter and ACMI
results.description: Cynthia Potter tells of her life in one of Melbourne’s Housing Commission flats and her beloved son Elvis. Energetic, with a passion for insects, Elvis makes the most of life, while Potter does the best she can with what she’s got.

results.title: Nothing impossible
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Aden Daud and ACMI
results.brief_description: When his country was thrown into civil war, Aden Daud’s friends would tell him to just waiting for his time to die. Instead, Daud decided to do something about it and seek out a more secure life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Aden Daud and ACMI

results.title: Going forward
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Laura Bell and ACMI
results.brief_description: Laura Bell reflects on her life through the things that have made her proud. Bell’s family, her community and her achievements are what keep her driven and passionate about her work.

results.title: These things I still question
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ken Saunders and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ken Saunders questions the things in his life that he didn’t understand, like why his dad was treated differently, why he couldn’t play with the white kids and why people just let this happen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ken Saunders and ACMI
